repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.unittitle: A. Philip Randolph Papers on Microfilm
did.abstract: Accompanied by printed reel guide compiled by David H. Werning.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: A. Philip Randolph (1889-1979) was one of the leading black protest leaders of the twentieth century. He was best known as the editor of the Messenger (a radical Socialist journal), as organizer of the Brotherhood of Sleeping Car Porters, and as the leader of the 1941 and 1963 Marches on Washington.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The A. Philip Randolph Collection consists of the following series: Family Papers, 1942-1963; General Correspondence, 1925-1978; Subject Files, 1909-1978; Speeches and writings File, 1941-1978; Biographical File, 1945-1979; and, Miscellany, 1920-1979.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: A. Philip Randolph Papers on Microfilm #5896 mf. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
